text:
Sara Hilary Haines[1] (born September 18, 1977) is an American television host and journalist, known for her work as a correspondent on Today, ABC News, and Good Morning America. Haines was a co-host of The View for seasons 20 and 21. Haines is the co-anchor of the third hour of Good Morning America, Strahan and Sara, alongside Michael Strahan.

Early life and education [ edit ]

Haines was born in Newton, Iowa, where she grew up with her parents and three siblings.[1] She attended Smith College in Northampton, Massachusetts, where she received a Bachelor of Arts degree in Government in 2000.[2] At Smith, Haines played basketball and volleyball.[3][4]

Career [ edit ]

Haines began her career in the NBC Page Program.[2] After nine months in the program,[4] Haines became the production coordinator for NBC's Today at Rockefeller Center in 2002.[1][5] In 2009, Haines became the show's fourth-hour contributing correspondent until she departed in 2013.[5]

In 2013, Haines became an ABC News correspondent as well as the pop news anchor for the weekend editions of Good Morning America. She left the weekend show in 2016.[6]

After multiple appearances as a guest co-host, Haines joined The View as a permanent co-host in the show's twentieth season, which premiered on September 6, 2016.[7] On July 23, 2018, ABC announced that she would be joining GMA with Michael Strahan from September 10, 2018.[8][9][10]

On the March 18, 2019 episode of the Strahan & Sara Show, Haines characterized St. Patrick's Day as an Irish celebration of "drinking and public urination". The comment prompted a backlash from the Irish American community including a statement from the Ancient Order of Hibernians which called for an apology.[11]

Personal life [ edit ]

On November 22, 2014, she married Max Shifrin in The Bahamas. The couple resides in Brooklyn.[12] They have two chihuahuas as pets.[13] Their son, Alec Richard Shifrin, was born March 5, 2016.[14] In June 2017, on an episode of The View, Haines announced that the couple was expecting their second child, a daughter,[15] who was born in December of the same year.[16] On January 3, 2019, Sara Haines announced she and her husband are expecting their third child. Her second son was born in June 2019.[17]

Haines is a Christian,[18] but she has not disclosed a specific denomination.
